00036 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------
00037  * (function: get_a_zero_pin)
00038  *      this allows us to attach to the constant netlist driving zero
00039  *---------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00040 npin_t *get_a_zero_pin(netlist_t *netlist)
00041 {
00042         npin_t *zero_fanout_pin = allocate_npin();      
00043         zero_fanout_pin->name = zero_string;
00044         add_a_fanout_pin_to_net(netlist->zero_net, zero_fanout_pin);
00045         return zero_fanout_pin;
00046 }
00047 
00048 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00049  * (function: get_a_one_pin)
00050  *      this allows us to attach to the constant netlist driving one
00051  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00052 npin_t *get_a_one_pin(netlist_t *netlist)
00053 {
00054         npin_t *one_fanout_pin = allocate_npin();       
00055         one_fanout_pin->name = one_string;
00056         add_a_fanout_pin_to_net(netlist->one_net, one_fanout_pin);
00057         return one_fanout_pin;
00058 }

00061 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00062  * (function: make_not_gate_with_input)
00063  *      Creates a not gate and attaches it to the inputs
00064  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00065 nnode_t *make_not_gate_with_input(npin_t *input_pin, nnode_t *node, short mark)
00066 {
00067         nnode_t *logic_node;    
00068 
00069         logic_node = make_not_gate(node, mark);
00070 
00071         /* add the input ports as needed */
00072         add_a_input_pin_to_node_spot_idx(logic_node, input_pin, 0);
00073 
00074         return logic_node;
00075 
00076 }
00077 
00078 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00079  * (function: make_not_gate)
00080  *      Just make a not gate
00081  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00082 nnode_t *make_not_gate(nnode_t *node, short mark)
00083 {
00084         nnode_t *logic_node;    
00085 
00086         logic_node = allocate_nnode();
00087         logic_node->traverse_visited = mark;
00088         logic_node->type = LOGICAL_NOT;
00089         logic_node->name = node_name(logic_node, node->name);
00090         logic_node->related_ast_node = node->related_ast_node;
00091 
00092         allocate_more_node_input_pins(logic_node, 1);
00093         allocate_more_node_output_pins(logic_node, 1);
00094 
00095         return logic_node;
00096 
00097 }
00098 
00099 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00100  * (function: make_1port_gate)
00101  *      Make a 1 port gate with variable sizes
00102  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00103 nnode_t *make_1port_gate(short type, int width_input, int width_output, nnode_t *node, short mark)
00104 {
00105         nnode_t *logic_node;    
00106 
00107         logic_node = allocate_nnode();
00108         logic_node->traverse_visited = mark;
00109         logic_node->type = type;
00110         logic_node->name = node_name(logic_node, node->name);
00111         logic_node->related_ast_node = node->related_ast_node;
00112 
00113         /* add the input ports as needed */
00114         allocate_more_node_input_pins(logic_node, width_input);
00115         add_input_port_information(logic_node, width_input);
00116         /* add output */
00117         allocate_more_node_output_pins(logic_node, width_output);
00118         add_output_port_information(logic_node, width_output);
00119 
00120         return logic_node;
00121 }
00122 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00123  * (function: make_1port_logic_gate)
00124  *      Make a gate with variable sized inputs and 1 output
00125  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00126 nnode_t *make_1port_logic_gate(short type, int width, nnode_t *node, short mark)
00127 {
00128         nnode_t *logic_node;    
00129 
00130         logic_node = make_1port_gate(type, width, 1, node, mark);
00131 
00132         return logic_node;
00133 }
00134 
00135 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00136  * (function: make_1port_logic_gate_with_inputs)
00137  *      Make a gate with variable sized inputs, 1 output, and connect to the supplied inputs
00138  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00139 nnode_t *make_1port_logic_gate_with_inputs(short type, int width, signal_list_t *pin_list, nnode_t *node, short mark)
00140 {
00141         nnode_t *logic_node;    
00142         int i;
00143 
00144         logic_node = make_1port_gate(type, width, 1, node, mark);
00145 
00146         /* hookup all the pins */
00147         for (i = 0; i < width; i++)
00148         {
00149                 add_a_input_pin_to_node_spot_idx(logic_node, pin_list->signal_list[i], i);
00150         }
00151 
00152         return logic_node;
00153 }
00154 
00155 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00156  * (function: make_3port_logic_gates)
00157  *      Make a 3 port gate all variable port widths. 
00158  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00159 nnode_t *make_3port_gate(short type, int width_port1, int width_port2, int width_port3, int width_output, nnode_t *node, short mark)
00160 {
00161         nnode_t *logic_node = allocate_nnode();
00162         logic_node->traverse_visited = mark;
00163         logic_node->type = type;
00164         logic_node->name = node_name(logic_node, node->name);
00165         logic_node->related_ast_node = node->related_ast_node;
00166 
00167         /* add the input ports as needed */
00168         allocate_more_node_input_pins(logic_node, width_port1);
00169         add_input_port_information(logic_node, width_port1);
00170         allocate_more_node_input_pins(logic_node, width_port2);
00171         add_input_port_information(logic_node, width_port2);
00172         allocate_more_node_input_pins(logic_node, width_port3);
00173         add_input_port_information(logic_node, width_port3);
00174         /* add output */
00175         allocate_more_node_output_pins(logic_node, width_output);
00176         add_output_port_information(logic_node, width_output);
00177 
00178         return logic_node;
00179 }
00180 
00181 
00182 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00183  * (function: make_2port_logic_gates)
00184  *      Make a 2 port gate with variable sizes.  The first port will be input_pins index 0..width_port1.
00185  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00186 nnode_t *make_2port_gate(short type, int width_port1, int width_port2, int width_output, nnode_t *node, short mark)
00187 {
00188         nnode_t *logic_node = allocate_nnode();
00189         logic_node->traverse_visited = mark;
00190         logic_node->type = type;
00191         logic_node->name = node_name(logic_node, node->name);
00192         logic_node->related_ast_node = node->related_ast_node;
00193 
00194         /* add the input ports as needed */
00195         allocate_more_node_input_pins(logic_node, width_port1);
00196         add_input_port_information(logic_node, width_port1);
00197         allocate_more_node_input_pins(logic_node, width_port2);
00198         add_input_port_information(logic_node, width_port2);
00199         /* add output */
00200         allocate_more_node_output_pins(logic_node, width_output);
00201         add_output_port_information(logic_node, width_output);
00202 
00203         return logic_node;
00204 }

00248 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00249  * (function: node_name_based_on_op)
00250  *      Get the string version of a node
00251  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00252 char *node_name_based_on_op(nnode_t *node)
00253 {
00254         char *return_string;
00255 
00256         switch(node->type)
00257         {
00258                 case MULTI_PORT_MUX: 
00259                         return_string = MULTI_PORT_MUX_string;
00260                         break;
00261                 case FF_NODE: 
00262                         return_string = FF_NODE_string;
00263                         break;
00264                 case BUF_NODE: 
00265                         return_string = BUF_NODE_string;
00266                         break;
00267                 case CLOCK_NODE: 
00268                         return_string = CLOCK_NODE_string;
00269                         break;
00270                 case INPUT_NODE: 
00271                         return_string = INPUT_NODE_string;
00272                         break;
00273                 case OUTPUT_NODE: 
00274                         return_string = OUTPUT_NODE_string;
00275                         break;
00276                 case GND_NODE: 
00277                         return_string = GND_NODE_string;
00278                         break;
00279                 case VCC_NODE: 
00280                         return_string = VCC_NODE_string;
00281                         break;
00282                 case ADD: 
00283                         return_string = ADD_string;
00284                         break;
00285                 case MINUS: 
00286                         return_string = MINUS_string;
00287                         break;
00288                 case BITWISE_NOT: 
00289                         return_string = BITWISE_NOT_string;
00290                         break;
00291                 case BITWISE_AND: 
00292                         return_string = BITWISE_AND_string;
00293                         break;
00294                 case BITWISE_OR: 
00295                         return_string = BITWISE_OR_string;
00296                         break;
00297                 case BITWISE_NAND: 
00298                         return_string = BITWISE_NAND_string;
00299                         break;
00300                 case BITWISE_NOR: 
00301                         return_string = BITWISE_NOR_string;
00302                         break;
00303                 case BITWISE_XNOR: 
00304                         return_string = BITWISE_XNOR_string;
00305                         break;
00306                 case BITWISE_XOR: 
00307                         return_string = BITWISE_XOR_string;
00308                         break;
00309                 case LOGICAL_NOT: 
00310                         return_string = LOGICAL_NOT_string;
00311                         break;
00312                 case LOGICAL_OR: 
00313                         return_string = LOGICAL_OR_string;
00314                         break;
00315                 case LOGICAL_AND: 
00316                         return_string = LOGICAL_AND_string;
00317                         break;
00318                 case LOGICAL_NOR: 
00319                         return_string = LOGICAL_NOR_string;
00320                         break;
00321                 case LOGICAL_NAND: 
00322                         return_string = LOGICAL_NAND_string;
00323                         break;
00324                 case LOGICAL_XOR: 
00325                         return_string = LOGICAL_XOR_string;
00326                         break;
00327                 case LOGICAL_XNOR: 
00328                         return_string = LOGICAL_XNOR_string;
00329                         break;
00330                 case MULTIPLY: 
00331                         return_string = MULTIPLY_string;
00332                         break;
00333                 case DIVIDE: 
00334                         return_string = DIVIDE_string;
00335                         break;
00336                 case MODULO: 
00337                         return_string = MODULO_string;
00338                         break;
00339                 case LT: 
00340                         return_string = LT_string;
00341                         break;
00342                 case GT: 
00343                         return_string = GT_string;
00344                         break;
00345                 case LOGICAL_EQUAL: 
00346                         return_string = LOGICAL_EQUAL_string;
00347                         break;
00348                 case NOT_EQUAL: 
00349                         return_string = NOT_EQUAL_string;
00350                         break;
00351                 case LTE: 
00352                         return_string = LTE_string;
00353                         break;
00354                 case GTE: 
00355                         return_string = GTE_string;
00356                         break;
00357                 case SR: 
00358                         return_string = SR_string;
00359                         break;
00360                 case SL: 
00361                         return_string = SL_string;
00362                         break;
00363                 case CASE_EQUAL: 
00364                         return_string = CASE_EQUAL_string;
00365                         break;
00366                 case CASE_NOT_EQUAL: 
00367                         return_string = CASE_NOT_EQUAL_string;
00368                         break;
00369                 case ADDER_FUNC:
00370                         return_string = ADDER_FUNC_string;
00371                         break;
00372                 case CARRY_FUNC:
00373                         return_string = CARRY_FUNC_string;
00374                         break;
00375                 case MUX_2:
00376                         return_string = MUX_2_string;
00377                         break;
00378                 default: 
00379                         oassert(FALSE);
00380                         break;
00381         }
00382         return return_string;
00383 }

00385 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00386  * (function: node_name)
00387  *      This creates the unique node name
00388  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00389 char *node_name(nnode_t *node, char *instance_name_prefix)
00390 {
00391         char *return_node_name;
00392         
00393         /* create the unique name for this node */
00394         return_node_name = make_full_ref_name(instance_name_prefix, NULL, NULL, node_name_based_on_op(node), unique_node_name_id);
00395 
00396         unique_node_name_id ++;
00397 
00398         return return_node_name;
00399 }
